skill.name: seed-data-generator
skill.description: Generate realistic test data for database development, testing, and demos.
skill.summary: Generate realistic test data for database development, testing, and demos.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond its own directory. Safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Creating realistic test data for databases is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill generates production-quality seed data using popular faker libraries while maintaining referential integrity across related tables.
actual_capabilities: Analyze database schema and identify tables, relationships, and constraints
Generate realistic test data using Faker.js, Python Faker, and other libraries
Create SQL INSERT statements for PostgreSQL, MySQL, and other databases
Build ORM-based seeders for Prisma, TypeORM, Sequelize, Django, and Rails
Maintain referential integrity with proper foreign key ordering
Generate reproducible seeds using configurable random seed values
limitations: Does not execute generated scripts or connect to databases directly
User must adapt examples to match their specific database schema
Requires user to have their database environment properly configured
Does not provide built-in data validation or constraint checking

use_cases.title: Set up local development databases
use_cases.description: Quickly populate development databases with realistic data for testing features during development.

use_cases.title: Create test data for testing scenarios
use_cases.description: Generate test data covering edge cases, happy paths, and various user scenarios for quality assurance.

use_cases.title: Generate demo data for presentations
use_cases.description: Create convincing demo data for presentations, screenshots, and customer demonstrations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic seed data request
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate seed data for a users table with columns: username, email, password_hash, active (boolean), created_at (timestamp). Include 10 sample users using faker.

prompt_templates.title: Schema analysis request
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this database schema and generate appropriate seed data with realistic relationships between users, products, orders, and order_items tables.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-table seeding
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete seed script for an e-commerce database with categories, products with category relationships, users, and orders with items. Include proper foreign key ordering.

prompt_templates.title: Reproducible seeding
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate reproducible seed data using a fixed random seed. Create 50 users, 100 products across 5 categories, and 200 orders with realistic status distribution and timestamps spread over 6 months.

output_examples.input: Generate seed data for a users table with username, email, and active status
output: Realistic usernames and email addresses matching each user
Timestamps spread across the past year

best_practices: Set a random seed value to make generated data reproducible across environments
Seed tables in correct order respecting foreign key dependencies (parents before children)
Use batch inserts instead of individual creates for better performance with large datasets
anti_patterns: Using the same password hash for all test users creates unrealistic and insecure test data
Hardcoding primary key IDs can cause conflicts when seeding existing databases
Generating data without checking constraints leads to foreign key violations and failed inserts

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Supports JavaScript/TypeScript with Faker.js, Python with Faker and Factory Boy, Ruby with Faker and FactoryBot, and raw SQL for any database.

faq.question: What database systems work with the generated data?
faq.answer: Generated SQL works with PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and other SQL databases. ORM examples support Prisma, TypeORM, Sequelize, Django, and Rails.

faq.question: How many records can be generated efficiently?
faq.answer: For large datasets, use batch insert APIs and database transactions. Scripts can generate millions of records when properly optimized.

faq.question: Is my production data at risk when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only generates code examples. It never connects to databases or executes queries. Always seed development and staging environments only.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing database schema?
faq.answer: Provide your schema details and the skill will generate seed scripts matching your column names, types, and relationship constraints.

faq.question: How is this different from other data generation tools?
faq.answer: This skill generates complete seed scripts you control rather than requiring installation of additional dependencies or configuration files.
